block.p: Shira Beth Kaplan and Eric Howard Kahan were married yesterday evening by Rabbi Joel Sisenwine at the Ritz-Carlton Hotel in Boston.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is a partner at Goldstein Rayner & Kaplan, a law firm in New York. She received a bachelor's degree and a J.D. from Columbia. She is the daughter of Honora Kaplan and Martin S. Kaplan, both of Newton, Mass. Her father is a senior partner at Hale & Dorr, a Boston law firm, and a former chairman of the Massachusetts Board of Education. Her mother is a partner at Fowlkes Jacoby & Kaplan, a law firm in Boston.

The bridegroom, 32, is a partner at Sperber & Denenberg, a law firm in New York. He graduated from the University of Wisconsin and Tulane University Law School. He is a son of Jo Ann Kahan and Dr. Bernard Kahan of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. His father, a dentist, is the vice president for acquisitions of the American Dental Group, a company in Bloomfield Hills that owns and manages dental offices in five states.
